label: FGD212
overview: FIBARO Dimmer 2 remotely controlled light dimming module is designed to work with various types of light sources.  It may be connected to  two-wire or three-wire configuration so it can operate with or without neutral lead. FIBARO Dimmer 2 can switch or dim connected light  source either through radio waves or through the wall switch connected directly to it.
inclusion:
1. Place the Dimmer 2 within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller
  2. Identify switch no. 1 (turns the light on) or the B-button (located on the device’s housing)
  3. Set the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode (see the controller’s manual)
  4. Quickly, three times press switch no. 1 or the B-button
  5. Wait for the adding process to end
  6. Successful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message
exclusion:
1. Place the Dimmer 2 within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller
  2. Identify switch no. 1 (turns the light on) or the B-button (located on the device’s housing)
  3. Set the main controller in remove mode (see the controller’s manual)
  4. Quickly, three times press switch no. 1 or the B-button
  5. Wait for the removing process to end
  6. Successful removing will be confrimed by the Z-Wave controller’s message
  7. Dimmer 2 will start the calibration process

parameters.label: Minimum brightness level
parameters.description: Set automatically during the calibration process
parameters.overview: The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

parameters.label: Maximum brightness level
parameters.description: Set automatically during the calibration process.
parameters.overview: The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.

parameters.label: Incandescence level of dimmable fluorescent lamps
parameters.description: Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on.
parameters.overview: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.

parameters.label: Incandescence time of dimmable fluorescent lamps
parameters.description: Time for switching fluorescent lamps and certain light sources.
parameters.overview: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

parameters.label: Dimming Step at Automatic Control
parameters.description: Percentage of a dimming step at automatic control.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the percentage of a dimming step at automatic control. 1-99

parameters.label: Dimming Step Timing at Automatic Control
parameters.description: Time of a dimming step at automatic control.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the time of a dimming step at automatic control. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s)

parameters.label: Dimming Step at Manual Control
parameters.description: Percentage of a dimming step at manual control.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the percentage of a dimming step at manual control. 1-99

parameters.label: Dimming Step Timing at Manual Control
parameters.description: Time of a dimming step at manual control.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the time of a dimming step at manual control. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s)

parameters.label: Saving state before power failure
parameters.description: Saving state before power failure

parameters.label: Timer functionality (auto - off).
parameters.description: Setting of the timer.
parameters.overview:
The parameter defines the setting of the timer.

Available settings:

  • 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h)
  • 0 disables the function

parameters.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF function
parameters.description: The parameter specifies the available functions.

options.label: ALL ON not active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameters.label: Force auto-calibration
parameters.description: Force the calibration process
parameters.overview: Changing the value of this parameter to 1 will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 and switched to 0 upon completion.

options.label: Force auto-calibration of the load w/o Bypass
Force auto-calibration of the load with Bypass

parameters.label: Auto-calibration status (read-only parameter)
parameters.description: Mode of the Dimmer (auto/man settings).
parameters.overview: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

parameters.label: Burnt out bulb detection
parameters.description: Percentage value of power variation
parameters.overview: Percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb). 1-99, 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Time delay of burnt out bulb/overload detection
parameters.description: Delay for power variation detection
parameters.overview: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer 2). 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Forced switch on brightness level
parameters.description: Switching on the Dimmer will always set this brightness level.
parameters.overview: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer 2 (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
parameters.description: Binary inputs type configuration

parameters.label: Value sent to associated devices on single click
parameters.description: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

options.label: Associated devices to last saved value

parameters.label: Change [On-Off] bi-stable keys
parameters.description: Allow user to change [On-Off] bi-stable keys
parameters.overview: This function allow user to change [On-Off] bi-stable keys (parameter no. 14) (default value 0)

options.label: Changes status on key status change
Device status depends on key status

parameters.label: Double click option
parameters.description: Double-click set lighting at 100%

parameters.label: Command frames sent in 2nd and 3rd assoc groups

parameters.overview: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups.

options.label: all actions send to association groups
do not send when switching ON (single click)
do not send when switching OFF (single click)
Do not send when changing dimming level
do not send on double click

parameters.description: Actions not resulting in sending frames to association groups
parameters.overview: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups.

options.label: all actions send to association groups
do not send when switching ON (single click)
do not send when switching OFF (single click)
do not send when changing dimming level
do not send on double click

parameters.label: The function of 3-way switch
parameters.description: Key no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally
parameters.overview: Key no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch).

parameters.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameters.description: Param. sent in specified assoc. groups: secure or non-secure
parameters.overview: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group.

parameters.label: Scene activation functionality
parameters.description: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configuration

parameters.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2
parameters.description: Switch S1 and S2 buttons

options.label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

parameters.label: Load control mode
parameters.description: The parameter defines the used control mode.

parameters.label: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibr.
parameters.description: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration

parameters.label: On/Off mode
parameters.description: Ignore brightening/- dimming time settings.
parameters.overview: This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Enabling parameter 32 automatically ignores brightening/- dimming time settings.

options.label: on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

parameters.label: Dimmability of the load (read only)
parameters.description: Dimmability of the load (read only)

parameters.label: Soft-Start functionality
parameters.description: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

parameters.label: Auto-calibration after power on
parameters.description: Determine the trigger of auto-calibration procedure
parameters.overview: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

options.label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibr. perfrmd after first pwr on/Load error
Auto-calibr. perfrmd after pwr on/LOAD ERROR

parameters.label: Behaviour of the Dimmer after overload or surge

options.label: three attempts to turn on the load

parameters.label: Power limit - OVERLOAD
parameters.description: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load
parameters.overview: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Parameter 39 is relevant only in a 3-wire connection i or a 2-wire connection for load of cosφ ≥ 0.99. (1 W - 250 W). 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: General Purpose Alarm
parameters.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameters.label: Water Flooding Alarm
parameters.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameters.label: Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
parameters.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameters.label: Temperature Alarm
parameters.description: The parameter specifies the response to an alarm.

parameters.label: Time of alarm state
parameters.description: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier
parameters.overview: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pushing the wall-switch keys or sending the Z-Wave command frame. Available settings: 1-32767 (1s - 32767s).

parameters.label: OVERLOAD alarm report
parameters.description: (load power consumption too high)

parameters.label: LOAD ERROR alarm report
parameters.description: (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

parameters.label: OVERCURRENT alarm report
parameters.description: (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

parameters.label: SURGE alarm report
parameters.description: (Dimmer output overvoltage)

parameters.label: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report
Active power reports
parameters.description: Power level change resulting in new power report being sent.
parameters.overview: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Periodic active power and energy reports
parameters.description: Time period between consecutive reports.
parameters.overview: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report (1 sec - 32767 sec). 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Energy reports
parameters.description: Energy level change resulting in sending a new energy report.
parameters.overview: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh). 0 disables the function.

parameters.label: Self-measurement
parameters.description: Active power and energy used by itself
parameters.overview: The Dimmer may include active power and energy used by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

parameters.label: Method of calculating the active power
parameters.description: How to calculate active power.
parameters.overview: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. Note: Parameter 58 is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration

options.label: measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

parameters.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
parameters.description: Power reported by the device at its maximum brightness level
parameters.overview: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W). Note: Parameter 59 works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0.

associations.label: Send BASIC SET command class frame S1
associations.overview:
2nd Association Group „On/Oﬀ (S1)” is assigned to switch no. 1.
Sends BASIC command class frame according to the state of the device

associations.label: Sends MULTILEVEL SWITCH command class frame S1
associations.overview:
3rd Association Group „Dimmer (S1)” is assigned to switch no. 1.
Sends MULTILEVEL SWITCH command class frame. Allows sending
dim/brighten command to associated devices.

associations.label: Sends BASIC SET command class S2
associations.overview:
4th Association Group „On/Oﬀ (S2)” is assigned to switch no. 2.
Sends BASIC command class frame according to the state of the device.

associations.label: Sends MULTILEVEL SWITCH command class frame S2
associations.overview:
5th Association Group „Dimmer (S2)” is assigned to switch no. 2.
Sends MulTIlEVEl SWITCH command class frame. Allows sending
dim/brighten command to associated devices.
